title: Trace: Failed Module Import
story: ImportError occurs when Python can't find or load a module. Understanding import errors helps you debug dependency issues.
instructions: Examine the traceback and determine why the import failed.

hints.text: ImportError/ModuleNotFoundError means Python couldn't find the module you tried to import.
Check if the module name is correct and if the package is installed.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 1, in <module>
    import mathplotlib
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'mathplotlib'
traceReading.buggyCode:
import mathplotlib
import numpy as np

data = [1, 2, 3]
print(data)

questions.question: What is the correct spelling of the module?
